lines.text: Enter IAGO and RODERIGO

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Here, stand behind this bulk straight will he come: Wear thy good rapier bare, and put it home: Quick, quick fear nothing Ill be at thy elbow: It makes us, or it mars us think on that, And fix most firm thy resolution.

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: Be near at hand I may miscarry int.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Here, at thy hand: be bold, and take thy stand.
Retires

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: I have no great devotion to the deed And yet he hath given me satisfying reasons: Tis but a man gone. Forth, my sword: he dies.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I have rubbd this young quat almost to the sense, And he grows angry. Now, whether he kill Cassio, Or Cassio him, or each do kill the other, Every way makes my gain: live Roderigo, He calls me to a restitution large Of gold and jewels that I bobbd from him, As gifts to Desdemona It must not be: if Cassio do remain, He hath a daily beauty in his life That makes me ugly and, besides, the Moor May unfold me to him there stand I in much peril: No, he must die. But so: I hear him coming.
Enter CASSIO

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: I know his gait, tis he.Villain, thou diest!
Makes a pass at CASSIO

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: That thrust had been mine enemy indeed, But that my coat is better than thou knowst I will make proof of thine.
Draws, and wounds RODERIGO

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: O, I am slain!
IAGO from behind wounds CASSIO in the leg, and exit

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: I am maimd for ever. Help, ho! murder! murder!
Falls
Enter OTHELLO

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: The voice of Cassio: Iago keeps his word.

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: O, villain that I am!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: It is even so.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: O, help, ho! light! a surgeon!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Tis he:O brave Iago, honest and just, That hast such noble sense of thy friends wrong! Thou teachest me. Minion, your dear lies dead, And your unblest fate hies: strumpet, I come. Forth of my heart those charms, thine eyes, are blotted Thy bed, luststaind, shall with lusts blood be spotted.
Exit
Enter LODOVICO and GRATIANO

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: What, ho! no watch no passage murder! murder!

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Tis some mischance the cry is very direful.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: O, help!

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Hark!

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: O wretched villain!

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Two or three groan: it is a heavy night: These may be counterfeits: lets thinkt unsafe To come in to the cry without more help.

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: Nobody come then shall I bleed to death.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Hark!
Reenter IAGO, with a light

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Heres one comes in his shirt, with light and weapons.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Whos there whose noise is this that ones on murder

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: We do not know.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Did not you hear a cry

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Here, here! for heavens sake, help me!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Whats the matter

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: This is Othellos ancient, as I take it.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: The same indeed a very valiant fellow.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: What are you here that cry so grievously

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Iago O, I am spoild, undone by villains! Give me some help.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: O me, lieutenant! what villains have done this

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: I think that one of them is hereabout, And cannot make away.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: O treacherous villains! What are you there come in, and give some help.
To LODOVICO and GRATIANO

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: O, help me here!

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Thats one of them.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: O murderous slave! O villain!
Stabs RODERIGO

lines.speaker: roderigo
lines.text: O damnd Iago! O inhuman dog!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Kill men i the dark!Where be these bloody thieves How silent is this town!Ho! murder! murder! What may you be are you of good or evil

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: As you shall prove us, praise us.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Signior Lodovico

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: He, sir.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I cry you mercy. Heres Cassio hurt by villains.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Cassio!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: How ist, brother!

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: My leg is cut in two.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Marry, heaven forbid! Light, gentlemen Ill bind it with my shirt.
Enter BIANCA

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: What is the matter, ho who ist that cried

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Who ist that cried!

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: O my dear Cassio! my sweet Cassio! O Cassio, Cassio, Cassio!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: O notable strumpet! Cassio, may you suspect Who they should be that have thus many led you

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: I am to find you thus: I have been to seek you.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Lend me a garter. So. O, for a chair, To bear him easily hence!

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: Alas, he faints! O Cassio, Cassio, Cassio!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Gentlemen all, I do suspect this trash To be a party in this injury. Patience awhile, good Cassio. Come, come Lend me a light. Know we this face or no Alas my friend and my dear countryman Roderigo! no:yes, sure: O heaven! Roderigo.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: What, of Venice

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Even he, sir did you know him

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Know him! ay.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Signior Gratiano I cry you gentle pardon These bloody accidents must excuse my manners, That so neglected you.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: I am glad to see you.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: How do you, Cassio O, a chair, a chair!

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Roderigo!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: He, he tis he. O, thats well said the chair!
A chair brought in

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Some good man bear him carefully from hence Ill fetch the generals surgeon. For you, mistress, Save you your labour. He that lies slain here, Cassio, Was my dear friend: what malice was between you
To BIANCA

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: None in the world nor do I know the man.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: [To BIANCA]  What, look you pale O, bear him out o the air. Stay you, good gentlemen. Look you pale, mistress Do you perceive the gastness of her eye Nay, if you stare, we shall hear more anon. Behold her well I pray you, look upon her: Do you see, gentlemen nay, guiltiness will speak, Though tongues were out of use.
CASSIO and RODERIGO are borne off
Enter EMILIA

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Las, whats the matter whats the matter, husband

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Cassio hath here been set on in the dark By Roderigo and fellows that are scaped: Hes almost slain, and Roderigo dead.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Alas, good gentleman! alas, good Cassio!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: This is the fruit of whoring. Prithee, Emilia, Go know of Cassio where he suppd tonight. What, do you shake at that
To BIANCA

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: He suppd at my house but I therefore shake not.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: O, did he so I charge you, go with me.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Fie, fie upon thee, strumpet!

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: I am no strumpet but of life as honest As you that thus abuse me.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: As I! foh! fie upon thee!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Kind gentlemen, lets go see poor Cassio dressd. Come, mistress, you must tells another tale. Emilia run you to the citadel, And tell my lord and lady what hath happd. Will you go on I pray. This is the night That either makes me or fordoes me quite. a light burning.
Aside
Exeunt
